page.title: 02WEATHER IN STEWARTON
page.content: The summer of 1985 has been the wettest in the memory of even the older members of the community.Farm crops are still in the fields unharvested and ground conditions are extremely soft and wet.There have been few weeks when more than one day has had no rain.The temperatures have however been almost the normal experienced in the area.The prevailing southwest winds have been mild,moist and warm.Children at school have rarely had the normal summer lessons outdoors since the beginning of June. The rivers in and around the town have many times this summer been brown rushing torrents and the banks have been flooded.The wet weather is still continuing even now in the middle of September.
